article_title: Bridge Query Legal Billings Adding Up; Christie's Chief of Staff, Kevin O'Dowd, Testifies Before Lawmakers
article_text:
TRENTON—New Jersey Gov. Chris Christie's administration has so far spent more than $3 million on lawyers in connection with the George Washington Bridge lane closures scandal, which a top aide on Monday called a "major distraction" for the governor.

Gibson, Dunn & Crutcher LLP, the firm hired by Mr. Christie in January, submitted $2.2 million in bills in February, according to state attorney general's office records...
